alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Pike; Susquehanna; Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:21AM EST until December 18 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Broome County in central New York... Southern Chenango County in central New York... Western Delaware County in central New York... Southwestern Otsego County in central New York... Northern Sullivan County in central New York... Northeastern Lackawanna County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northern Pike County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Eastern Susquehanna County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Wayne County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 200 PM EST. * At 1021 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oneonta, Carbondale, Honesdale, Walton, Deposit, Archbald, Sidney, Damascus, Neversink, Callicoon, Guilford, Sanford, Colchester, Susquehanna, Forest City, Mayfield, Coventry, Susquehanna Depot, Greene and Oxford. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
